title: Bidirectional Data Exchange
content:
Concept

This topic explores bidirectional data exchange within the context of Streamlit. You will learn how to apply the concept to build robust, maintainable, and user-friendly apps.

Why it matters

Advanced Streamlit patterns let you ship production-ready apps with fewer surprises. Mastery here improves user experience, performance, and long-term maintainability.

Core APIs / Syntax

Below are minimal examples that illustrate the essential APIs and patterns.

import streamlit as st

st.title("Custom Components — Bidirectional Data Exchange")
st.write("Hello from an advanced example.")

import streamlit as st
import streamlit.components.v1 as components

components.html("""
  

    
    
Custom UI

  

""")

Common pitfalls

• Overusing reruns without caching can cause sluggish UIs. • Global mutable state can create race conditions with callbacks. • Disconnected page-level state harms UX. • Not profiling heavy code paths leads to timeouts.

Practice

1) Extend the example to a realistic scenario. 2) Add validation and error handling. 3) Measure the impact (latency, memory) and document your findings.
